content.text:
# Analysis of Main Target Image

The main target image shows a structure consisting of two distinct parts:

## Left Structure:
- A red block with a circular hole as the base
- Yellow half-cylinder blocks on top
- An orange triangular roof

## Right Structure:
- A red base with three arches in a row
- An orange cylindrical tower in the center
- Yellow rectangular blocks on either side of the tower
- An orange triangular roof on top of the tower
- A green rectangular block on the far right

In total, the structure uses approximately 10-11 blocks arranged in 2-3 layers.

## Block Selection from Dictionary

Based on the main image, I need the following blocks:

1. For the left structure:
   - Block 2 (red U-shaped block)
   - Two Block 12 pieces (yellow half-cylinder blocks)
   - Block 15 (orange triangular roof piece)
   - Block 16 (orange triangular side piece)

2. For the right structure:
   - Block 1 (red arch block)
   - Block 3 and Block 4 (red arch blocks)
   - Block 11 (orange cylindrical tower)
   - Block 10 (yellow vertical rectangular block)
   - Block 8 or 9 (yellow horizontal rectangular block)
   - Block 15 (orange triangular roof piece)
   - Block 7 (green horizontal rectangular block)

## Assembly Order

```
{
   Step1: Move block with index 1
   Step2: Move block with index 3
   Step3: Move block with index 4
   Step4: Move block with index 11
   Step5: Move block with index 10
   Step6: Move block with index 9
   Step7: Move block with index 15
   Step8: Move block with index 7
   Step9: Move block with index 2
   Step10: Move block with index 12
   Step11: Move block with index 12
   Step12: Move block with index 15
   Step13: Move block with index 16
}
```

This assembly order first builds the right structure (steps 1-8) and then builds the left structure (steps 9-13).
